*  Represents a general exception that is not caught by any of the other exceptions.
* Represents an Exception Handler that can display to user the respective error messages when required.
* Used by Duke to handle exceptions thrown in the Main program.
* Displays an error that indicates to the user that an incorrect format for Date/Time has been given.
String errorMessage = Ui.spaces(5) + "Unable to parse Date & Time of task!\n"
+ Ui.spaces(5) + "Please follow the following format for Date & Time:\n\n"
* Displays an error that indicates to the user that a valid DukeCommand input has been given,
* but Duke has trouble evaluating it due to abnormal input somewhere in the command given.
* @param e The IncorrectDukeCommand to display the error message of.
String errorMessage = String.format("%sLooks like the above Duke Command has failed. That's because...\n\n%s",
* Displays an error that indicates to the user that an invalid DukeCommand has been given.
String errorMessage = Ui.spaces(5) + "I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means... \u2639";
* Displays an error that indicates to the user that no input was given when prompted for one.
String errorMessage = Ui.spaces(5) + "I can't do anything if you don't tell me what to do... \ud83d\ude2d";
* Displays an error that indicates to the user that an error occurred with file saving/loading.
* This error should not appear unless the user created a directory with an identical name and path
* as the file that is saved to keep track of user's tasks when the program exits.
String errorMessage = Ui.spaces(5) + "File could not be read/saved.";
* Displays a general DukeException that is not caught by any of the above to the user.
* Represents an exception that reflects a valid input command but with unrecognizable contents.
* Represents an exception that indicates to user that the input command does not exist.
super(Ui.spaces(5) + "I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means... \u2639");
* Represents an exception that indicates to user that no input is detected.
super("     I can't do anything if you don't tell me what to do... \ud83d\ude2d");

* Represents a Storage object that loads or saves user tasks upon program
* Saves and updates user tasks by adding on to a local save file when a new task is added.

* @param task The Task to be saved.
* @throws IOException if the task cannot be saved.
public void addToLocalSave(Task task) throws IOException {

* @throws IOException if any of the tasks cannot be saved.
public void overwriteLocalSave(ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks) throws IOException {

* Creates a task that needs to be done before a specific date/time.
* Constructs a Deadline task with its description, deadline and completion status.
* This constructor is used only when a Deadline task is read from a local save file.
* @param desc The description of the deadline.
* @param dateTime The due date of the deadline, consists of a single date and time.
* @param isDone The completion status of the Deadline task.
public Deadline(String desc, String dateTime, boolean isDone) {
* Creates a task that start at a specific time and ends at a specific time.
* Constructs a Event task with its description, deadline and completion status.
* This constructor is used only when a Event task is read from a local save file.
* @param desc The description of the event.
* @param dateTime The event period. Consists of a single date but with start time and end time.
* @param isDone The completion status of the Event task.
public Event(String desc, String dateTime, boolean isDone) {
